newsitem.title: INDIA: HSBC unit sets up merchant bank in India.
newsitem.headline: HSBC unit sets up merchant bank in India.

text.p: HSBC Investment Banking, a unit of HSBC Holdings Plc, said on Thursday that it is setting up a merchant bank in India.

HSBC Investment Banking said in a statement released in New Delhi that India's Foreign Investment Promotion Board had approved a $20-million equity investment in HSBC Capital Markets India Private Ltd, making it one of the largest dedicated merchant banks in the country.
It said an application had been submitted to the Securities and Exchange Board of India for a Category One merchant banking licence.

"This investment demonstrates our commitment to India and we are very pleased that we are able to enhance our presence," the statement quoted HSBC Investment Bank Asia Holdings Ltd chairman Paul Selway-Swift as saying.
HSBC Investment Banking handles the merchant banking, equity securities and asset management activities of the HSBC group.

The statement said HSBC Capital Markets India will specialise in the four products of equity capital markets, debt capital markets, financial advisory including mergers and acquisitions, and project finance.
It will have offices in New Delhi, Bombay, Calcutta and Madras.
